Reviews.Title: “Small, personal and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Presuminged
Reviews.Content: Avoid the hustle-bustle of the main island by staying in the lido. Just a short water bus trip to the sights. Russo palace is a small and friendly hotel with nice modern room (not large but adequate) and good service. Some rooms have the odd plumbing issue but on the whole this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: mini_me1987
Reviews.Content: We were placed in room 302. The hotel lobby and hallways were absolutely beautiful with marble floors. The rooms on the other hand were in need of renovation. They were clean but had several little issues. EG The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor- dangerous for myself with a broken thumb. However, the view was astounding! I actually think we were paying for the view. The room was also lovely and warm, it was October and typical rainy October weather but we didn't need sheets, which was also good as the sheets were of poor quality. A very good thing was the mini bar which was really cheap! it was only 3 euros for a beer. However the walls were rather thin. We could hear everything going on next door- mainly a lot of showering! The breakfast was O.K. there was choice and variety. We bought spa passes from the hotel before we went. The spa isn't actually in the hotel but in another hotel which is 20 mins walk away. It is a lovely spa but the hotel would benefit from having this in house rather than in a separate hotel. Staff were friendly and bilingual which was very useful. Also the location of Lido is great as the water buses are regular and not too far from the hotel. Overall a good trip. A nice hotel but nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat on the Lido within easy reach of the other Venice islands”
Reviews.Author: SheilaLaurence
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, value for money, hotel in easy reach of the main islands of Venice, but away from the hustle and bustle. The Russo Palace Hotel did not disappoint. We were greeted with a friendly smile and useful information on the area. Our room was on the ground floor so was very easy to access. The price was extremely reasonable so we weren't expecting to have a view over the main lagoon; our room looked out onto a small canal at the back of the hotel, which made it quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice of hot and cold food. The restaurant had a small area outside for the warmer mornings which looked out across the lagoon. Dinner isn't served at the hotel, but there are plenty of places to eat on the Lido. Prices vary, so look at the menus outside before venturing in. The hotel is a short walk from the AliLaguna (or other) waterbus terminal. These take you across the water to the main islands of Venice quickly, but make sure you're on the right one. Ask before getting aboard as there are several different routes. We are looking to return to the Russo Palace Hotel next year as we so enjoyed the area and would like another chance to discover more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but Rooms are Tiny”
Reviews.Author: canadatraveller72
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, very helpful and very nice. Very patient with tourists. Located in the perfect place in Venice. It is on Lido island which is slower and more relaxed than the main islands. The beach is on Lido island. It is a 10 minute ferry to San Marco Piazza. The bus service on Lido is excellent. Nice night life and restaurants on Lido. The rooms are very clean but I felt claustrophobic. The bathroom was as big as the room. As long as you aren't going to spend your days in the hotel, I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel as long as you dont get the top floor!!”
Reviews.Author: dsjfnjufds
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Short, 10 min walk to ferry on Lido Island and beautiful views of Venice. The top floor, however, is unacceptable!! You can not stand up in the room, you cant shower because the ceiling is so slanted and it is very hot with the sun scorching through the roof directly into the room. The air conditioner can not even keep up with the heat. We couldn't understand how they could charge the same rate for that room as for a beautiful room on the ground floor. With that said, we loved our stay on Lido and would go back as long as we didn't stay on the top floor. Also, while in Venice get the rolling venice pass for the ferry rides. You will be taking the ferry many times a day and its well worth it in savings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: maxster34
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, superb location & staff. Overlooking the Venice Lagoon (although not all rooms do) 10 minute walk from the Lido centre, water taxi's/buses & beach. Hotel room was clean & tidy with maid service daily, hotel staff are very friendly and extremely helpful, there to help you 24 hours a day...nothing was a problem, we were very lucky on arrival to find our room had a shared (although no else was staying in the room next door so we ended up with it all to ourselves) patio area with glorious views of Venice. Transfers from Marco Polo Airport cost Â£100 by private taxi, each way..or Â£25 return by public transport water bus which takes approx 50 mins..but saves you Â£175 per couple. Loads of people warned us that it's very expensive to stay & eat out in Venice...not the case, food was reasonably priced..sometimes cheaper than the UK(including service charge), it's only really alcohol that's a little pricey varying from 4-8 euros for a pint of lager. Most of the beaches are private and cost vary greatly depending on whereabouts on the beach you go..but there is a free beach where you can just plonk a towel down and enjoy the sunshine..but there's also loungers available for 20 euro for 2 with umbrella & free use of toilets, showers etc (this will cost 1 euro otherwise). Reads some negative reviews for this hotel prior to going...and seriously can't understand why you could find anything negative to say about it?? Will definitely go back next year...and am really looking forward to it :) enjoy xx

Reviews.Title: “Water taxis on strike and hotel won't refund!”
Reviews.Author: belladolcevita
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to our stay at this hotel, however the one night we arrived in Venice, we learned that the water taxis were on strike and were therefore unable to get over to Lido, an island off of Venice. I had called and spoken to a "manager" named Anna Lisa who understood the situation and said we wouldn't be charged. After returning to the states, I've been trying for a month to get our money back from them and they are unwilling. Anna Lisa went back on her word and it's very frustrating as a customer in a foriegn country. She offered a "discount" next time we were in Venice...probably not going to happen in the next ten years but thanks anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Brigette10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, great service, friendly staff. Stayed on the first floor and the balcony had a great view of the Lagoon. Very quiet and Clean, would highly recommend. Only a five minute walk to the Ferry and a great choice of cafes and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great views!”
Reviews.Author: dlumenau
Reviews.Content: For a couple that have had a whirlwind start to their romance, and having met the parents, it was time for me to meet the sister! As a dancer on a cruise ship docking on the Monday afternoon in Venice, we thought that we should take full advantage of the weekend before to fall even more in love. (WARNING: It only gets soppier from here on). As a young couple, on a budget, we set about finding a happy medium between price and glamour in Venice, and boy did the Russo Palace deliver! The staff were endlessly helpful, even sending the chambermaid up to iron our clothes for us when we were in a rush! The view across the lagoon is incredible, with San Marco clearly visible from the front door! Also: * Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. * Room was immaculate. * Transport to San Marco took 10 minutes by boat...and wow...what a view on the way in! We did fall even more in love. Thank you Russo Palace, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Strange room policy”
Reviews.Author: immersonntags
Reviews.Content: I booked about a week ehead of time and was given "the last room", namely one under the roof with no view and walls so slanted that it was not possible to stand up for a shower. The next day I asked if another room was free and the lady at the reception said: o, yes, we have plenty of rooms, I don't understand why my colleague did not give you another one. So I changed rooms, but when I checked out, they still charged the same amount for the inferior room as for the better one,

Reviews.Title: “Damp, dirty, smelly-don't book last minute!”
Reviews.Author: salsaqueenLondon
Reviews.Content: First fo all, the hotel breakfast was lovely and the hotel staff were also very helpful. The problem was we booked last minute, whilst we think that the hotel is in a lovely quiet area of Lido, the hotel is very small and very busy. They first gave us a room on the top floor, without a view, as only had small windows on the ceiling. The bathroom had no shower, because you couldnt stand up in the room and the bath you would have had to roll in and out off. So we asked for a room change. The only room they had that didnt give us clautrophobia, was a room that was clearly old, had mould on the sheets, an infestation of mosquitoes, without working air con-definitely NOT 4 star!! This was the worst night sleep we have ever had abroad! The hotel staff were very apologetic, but we checked out the next day and moved on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Wilf40
Reviews.Content: Though on Lido Island very easy access from/to Venice airport by Alilaguna boats which takes about one hour plus some 10 mins to walk. Easy access to/from downtown Venice by public boats within 5, alternatively some10 mins walking distance, thus more convenient and quiet than any downtown accomodation. Extremely helpful staff. And on top: a super panorama across the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “I will go again”
Reviews.Author: Mirko63
Reviews.Content: I have to suggest to stay on Lido not Venice. Its a great little island with its own charm and it has a beach which is great. Its really easy to get to on the watherbus, ferryboat and the island is a very safe and clean. Our stay ( my wife and I ) at Russo Palace Hotel (we spent 7 nights from 14-21 September) was a fabulous experience, the hotel is lovely overlooking the Lagoon. The Hotel is done with murano glass all over the place with cherry wood also. The staff is excellent, and very helpful, always ready to inform you about everything you wish to now. I mean everything, shops, restaurants, gift shop, banks, and all you can ask. They speak almost any language so its really easy to tell you all you need. Rooms are clean, with nice furniture, tv, sky box with many programs, and every room have safe in a closet . They have central AC so its easy to set temperature for perfect relaxation. Very clean and well kept, the maids do an excellent job. View from hotel is superb as you can easily see the Doge's Palace and the Campanile Tower. At breakfast you are spoilt for choice, fruit, cereals, breads, pastries, everything you could want. All types of coffee, juice and everything else. Excellent aroma of breakfast first thing every morning , worth getting up, no need for clock alarm. Hotel is really nice, and I cant say nothing bad from any aspect. If you are lucky like we were, you can be in Lido just when was Venice film festival and you can see all glamour of film industry, actors, parties and famous red carpet ! I was really pleased with my stay there and I will certainly stay at Russo Palace again, as I plan to go back to Venice many times in the future. Lido is super place to stay . Would recommend this hotel every time. Ps. I have 1gb of pictures to prove everything I sed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a fabulous experience, the hotel is lovely overlooking the Lagoon. Very clean and well kept, the maids do an exellent job. Our room was a double superior on the 3rd floor with a lagoon view, it was great to watch the lagoons activity early morning and evening, even the cruise ships entering and leaving Venice. There is a bench across the road on the promenade which was my favourite place morning and evening, just to sit and watch in tranquility. The staff were excellent, and very helpful, they provided a free private water taxi to take us to Murano which was a fabulous experience. At breakfast you are spoilt for choice, fruit, cereals, breads, pastries, everything you could want. They also have a cooked breakfast of sausage, egg etc but you have to pay extra for this. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from the main boatstop S. M. Elisabeta, that takes you over to St Marks in 15 mins, there are regular buses that run up and down to the stop in 2 mins, but a word of warning, the buses stop running toward the stop at 8pm, they still come back till late though. I was suprised to learn this from the hotel staff as I had done extensive research. A bit disappointed that there is not much in the line of restaurants, shops and bars in the area, most are near the boat stop 15 mins away. It is much cheaper on the Lido than Venice itself, and there are some good restuarants in Gran Viale S. M. E. also plenty of shops and bars. I will certainly stay at Russo Palace again, as I plan to go back to Venice many times in the future, and the price is fabulous for a 4 star hotel, we paid 99 euros a night for a superior double in June, and would highly recommend it to others. Jess UK

Reviews.Title: “Attic room”
Reviews.Author: AK_Lombard
Reviews.Content: The first thing I have to say is don't stay in Venice, stay on Lido. Its a great little island with its own charm and it has a beach which is great. Its really easy to get to on the waterbus, which runs 24hours and the island has a very safe suburb feel to it. I would rate this hotel as a really good 3 star but not a 4 star. The hotel staff are very helpful and polite. The breakfast is good, cereal, toast, egg etc, and you can eat it outside on the patio over looking the lagoon. We stayed in the attic room (classed as double economy) and paid 64 euro incl breakfast and taxes. The room is quite small, and you can only stand upright on one side. But we didnâ€™t mind as were only staying one night, and spend the whole day out in Venice and lido and so only really came back to the hotel to sleep. There were two things that impressed me about this room. 1) they had a sky box with lots of channels! I like watching tv at the end of the day before I go to sleep, and it was great to watch some NBA sports, fox sitcoms and they were all in english (other hotels dub them in italian). 2) the bathroom was very nice and clean and the bathtub doubled up as a Jacuzzi which was very relaxing. However, the attic room is not for everyone. If youâ€™re just staying for a night and donâ€™t mind a small slanted room (probably suit younger people who don't mind too much about their sleeping conditions), then its fine. Otherwise get the classic double, which is a normal room with the same amenities. One thing to note, is the mosquitos. My partner woke up in the morning with 11 bites all over her. I had none. I have read from other reviewers that theyâ€™ve been bitten too, but am giving the hotel the benefit of the doubt (especially since I had no bites). Overall, I really liked Lido island and so the hotel location was great. The room amenities were excellent, and the price was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with lovely views”
Reviews.Author: VickyHerts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is based on the Lido island a few minutes walk from the beach and Vaparetto from Venice. Staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel was a great base to explore the city but escape the crowds and experience a more relaxed environment in the evenings. Rooms were cleaned to a high standard and breakfast was excellent for those with a big appetite. The hotel offers a free water taxi into the city in the mornings which is prompt and should be booked. The staff stored our bags on the last day and for 2 days when we went to Verona, which was a great help in light of the transfers to be made! Most rooms have a good view across the water to the centre of Venice with upgraded rooms having balcony's. I thoroughly enjoyed the stay, especially the sense of relief in getting away from the crowds. However the additional cost of having to buy Vaparetto tickets should be considered when booking this hotel as you can't always get a free ride across the water!! A single is 6 euros each way per person so plan your outings well in the city. Most restaurants on the Lido get busy and we found that most were closed on Thursday, so plan to eat for 7:30 p.m. or a little later. Food on the Lido is also reasonably priced with a meal in the city setting you back at least 70 euros for 2 with house wine!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: scarlet_ibis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but not 4* by my standards. The reception area is nice and all the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are average - a bit tired and dim, but neat and clean. The bathroom in my room, however, was really cute - it had obviously been renovated and was very new, modern and bright . A shame that the rest of the room hadn't been renewed also. My main issue with this place is that there was no room service, so I arrived late and couldn't order anything to eat. There is a list entitled "cafe" - but they only sell alcoholic drinks (not even tea or coffee, and there are no facilities in the room). The breakfast was OK - a standard continental buffet, nothing very exciting. A pity they didn't use the expresso machine for the coffee! The services are there, but they're not very good: there is a TV, but you only get 2 Italian stations or otherwise you can pay for movies there is a minibar, but no snacks and some of the spirit bottles were already open there are internet and laundry, but quite expensive. Unless you need to be on the Lido, I'd advise finding something more central.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use room 1”
Reviews.Author: caarlii
Reviews.Content: The Russo Palace is a lovely hotel situated on a quiet island in the Venetian Lagoon. It's a short hop to Venice on the Vaporetto and the peace and quiet is well worth the journey. We stayed for 2 nights. The first night we were allocated room 1 on the ground floor. The room is big and comfortable, but with no view of any kind. The room smelt rather badly of raw sewage - the only room in the hotel to do so. We asked if we could change rooms because of the smell and were told we could do so if we paid an extra 90 Euros per night. We couldn't afford this so we asked for some air freshener to make the smell more bearable. When we went to bed that night it was very cold so we turned on the heating. What a noise!!!! There was a problem with the heater in the room which made it sound like a motor boat. We got no sleep during the first night. The heating could not be turned off and woke us every hour when it turned on. By morning we were very tired and were not looking forward to tromping round Venice in such a state. We asked the desk clerk if there was any possibility of changing rooms as we were not willing to use that room again. We were considering moving hotel if nothing could be done and applying for a refund from the Russo. The desk clerk was very nice and agreed to move us to another room without having to pay extra as compensation. He seemed surprised that the room smelt and that the heating was noisy, but I suspect they knew this and used the room for cheap travellers, maybe to charge extra money for moving? The room we used on the second night was small, but had a view of the lagoon and didn't smell. The heater worked properly, too. The buffet breakfast is very basic, but did seem to fill us until lunchtime. Don't expect too much. We ordered 2 items at one time from room service to save on room service charges, but were charged 5 euros per item anyway. I do believe we were overcharged, but we were too tired to argue by that time. All in all we had a lovely stay in Venice, but next time we go we will use another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieTse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Russo Palace Hotel for 3 nights during our honeymoon trip in Europe. It was a great stay. We chose a deluxe room with a seaview and a balcony. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly and willing to accomodate all your requests. I was nice to stay away from the tourist area and go back to this quiet Lido island at the end of the day. We walked by the seashore everytime we went to the waterbus station and it was so relaxed and enjoyable. I will definitely stay in this hotel again if I visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marmi2
Reviews.Content: Lovely family holiday (ages from 17 to 89) in Venice made possible by welcoming and helpful staff. Excellent services and amenities. Very clean. Breakfast every day (plenty of choice) overlooking the lagoon with view of St. Marks. Dine at Trattoria la Battigia (hotel will tell you where it is) and try the small fish restaurant round the corner next to the canal

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Russo Palace for 3 nights at the start of Feb 06. It is situated in Lido which can be reached by a 50 minute water bus ride from Marco Polo Airport. It is then a five minute walk from the water bus stop in Lido to the hotel. The first thing that struck me about this hotel was how clean everything was. It is a fairly new hotel and all the decor still looks brand new and everywhere is spotless. Our room was a little on the small side, as was the bathroom but it was functional enough and the bed was nice and comfortable. Breakfast was good if a little uninspired - cereal, bread, ham, boiled eggs, fruit juices and coffee. The view from the breakfast room towards St. Marks square is great. It takes about 10 mins by waterbus to reach St. Marks square from the Lido and costs 5 Euros each way which I thought was quite reasonable. Venice is lovely, but it was quite nice to return to Lido at the end of the day which is a lot quieter than Venice itself at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: AlisonS
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights (8-11 October 2005) at this lovely hotel. Went with 2 friends who paid the extra â‚¬30 per night for the balcony view over the lagoon to Venice. We had side/back views of lagoon/canal which were perfectly fine. Excellent aroma of breakfast first thing every morning - worth getting up for as food was lovely. Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel offer complimentary water taxi to Murano Island and the glass factory. This is a must! Ordinary water bus from Lido to Venice was regular service and good fun. 24 hour ticket is only â‚¬10.50 each and good value. View from hotel is superb as you can easily see the Doge's Palace and the Campanile Tower. In our view, Lido is super place to stay as you see Venice from across the water. Would recommend this hotel every time. We got the water bus from the airport (50 mins) to Lido at â‚¬10 each but chose to leave in style on a water taxi costing â‚¬90 for the 4 of us. The water taxi took only 15 minutes from the Hotel's private jetty and we felt like James Bond!! Worth saving some money for!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to English standard of 4*”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes145
Reviews.Content: Billed as a 4* hotel the Russo Palace didnt come up to expectations. The hotel was clean but the rooms very small with no tea or coffee facilities in the room. We paid extra for a balcony with a view which believe me is necessary. The only meal available was breakfast and in a 4* we would have expected to have been able to get an evening meal. If staying in Venice it was way out (at least an hour on the water bus which stopped at every stop along the way!!). All in all the hotel was ok for a 3 night stay but anything more you would want one with more facilities on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again, if we get a chance to go back...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked for a 12-14 Apr 2005 stay at this hotel thru hotels. Before we started our trip, we knew that we will be arriving very late into Venice since we took a late flight from London. So, I decided to contact the hotel to advise them of our late check-in. After getting their contact info from hotels, I emailed the hotel ASAP. The next day, I already got a response from them, assuring us that our room will be available when we arrive. The email even included their guide on how to get to the hotel thru different means with the suggested price to pay. Not contented with the email, I called the hotel just as we were leaving from the London airport, again advising them that we were on our way and we were arriving very late. Again, I was assured that our room was ready and waiting. Using the guide that they sent us, we arrived at the hotel without much trouble using the public water bus. By the time we stepped up to the front-desk, the guy just gave us the key to the room. He already knew who we were! :) We were waken-up that morning, and every morning after that, by their heavenly and sweet-smelling buffet breakfast. We did not really need to setup the alarm in the room nor arrange for a wake-up call ever. The morning breakfast was enough to wake us up! The location is in Lido, which is a few minutes away from the Venizia island by water bus. We did not care. The short walk from the water bus station to the hotel was not a big deal to us either. Everytime we take that walk, it was very romantic, even the times we had to drag our luggages with us. We will definitely stay in this hotel again, if we ever get another chance to go back to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Russo Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Riviera San Nicolo 11/A, 30126 Venice, Italy
